title: The Bachelorette's Jess Glasgow spotted for the first time since scandal
text:
Disgraced politician Jess Glasgow is fearing for his life after receiving 'death threats' following his controversial appearance on The Bachelorette.

The local Noosa councillor, who was branded 'creepy' and 'disgusting' for his predatory behaviour around Angie Kent, told Daily Mail Australia that someone had emailed him anonymously saying they would 'run him over'.

'It's very serious. I had a guy email me saying, "I know you ride a scooter and if I see you on your scooter, I'll run you over",' he said.

Scroll down for video

Backlash: Disgraced politician Jess Glasgow is fearing for his life after receiving 'death threats' following his controversial appearance on The Bachelorette. Pictured in Noosa on Friday

The 37-year-old has also received threatening phone calls from people warning him 'never to show his face in south east Queensland ever again'.

As he headed into council chambers in Noosa on Friday, the Sunshine Coast local was confronted by a male protester holding a sign that read, 'Sack Sleazy Jess'.

Over the past 24 hours, he has faced calls to resign from Noosa Mayor Tony Wellington, who has described his behaviour on The Bachelorette as 'misogynistic' and 'highly offensive'.

His is also under investigation for a potential breach of conduct as a result of his behaviour on the dating show. The matter has been referred to the Office of the Independent Assessor.

Man of the people? Jess shook the protester's hand as they discussed his recent controversy

Mr Wellington also held a press conference on Friday, telling reporters that he has told Jess 'to seriously consider resigning from his position as councillor on the Noosa Council.'

On Thursday night's episode of The Bachelorette, Jess joked that Angie was going to 'ride' him and brazenly told her he 'might get some wandering fingers'.

Later in the episode, he called Angie a 'b**ch*' after being told she wanted to speak to him about his inappropriate behaviour on set.

Too far: During a farmyard-themed photo shoot, Jess positioned his head next to Angie's bottom and proceeded to poke his tongue out and make rude gestures (pictured)

'I'm going to find the love of my life in a dirty nightclub': Jess was eventually sent packing, but told producers on the limousine ride home that his journey to finding love was far from over

Bachelorette Angie's brutal farewell During Thursday's episode of The Bachelorette, Angie Kent said that Jess 'gave [her] the creeps' during their group date. But she didn't confront him until learning that he had also made female crew members uncomfortable with his persistent flirting. During their showdown at the cocktail party, Angie told Jess: 'You made me feel very uncomfortable at the photo shoot. I said I wanted fun, but I feel like you took it too far. 'I will never allow a man to come in and f**k with my sisterhood. Never. 'I feel like you think this is a joke, and that really annoys me. You never talk about me as a person. You always just talk about me as a piece of meat.' As Jess interrupted to apologise for 'acting inappropriately', Angie snapped: 'I really don't believe a word that you say. 'I don't trust you and I'm sorry, you're gonna have to leave.' Dumped: Jess was sent home on Thursday's episode of The Bachelorette, after Angie Kent (pictured) confronted him over his inappropriate behaviour After packing his bags and being driven away in the limousine, Jess denied any wrongdoing. 'Apparently I was a bit crude to her on the photo shoot. That's bulls**t,' he said. 'Apparently that was too sexualising. I don't know. Obviously, it's just a different of opinion. I know deep down nothing happened.' He then added: 'I'm going back to Noosa to find the love of my life in a dirty, dingy nightclub.'

He was eventually sent packing, but told producers on the limousine ride home that his journey to finding love was far from over.

'I'm going back to Noosa to find the love of my life in a dirty, dingy nightclub,' he said.

As he continues to face a backlash for his portrayal on the show, Jess told Daily Mail Australia that his one supporter is his new girlfriend.

He's taken, ladies! As he continues to face a backlash for his portrayal on the show, Jess told Daily Mail Australia that his one supporter is his new girlfriend

In the doghouse! He described his girlfriend as his 'light at the end of the tunnel', but admitted that she 'cringed' at some of his behaviour on The Bachelorette

He described his girlfriend as his 'light at the end of the tunnel', but admitted that she 'cringed' at some of his behaviour on The Bachelorette.

'I wouldn't be surprised if she left me. It's not the kind of attention you want. If I were her, I would leave me,' he added.

When asked why an up-and-coming politician would appear on a dating show, Jess said he saw it as an opportunity to find a partner.

'I'm pretty time poor so I decided to go on TV and went on with an open heart,' he said.

Bad move: When asked why an up-and-coming politician would appear on a dating show, Jess said he saw it as an opportunity to find a partner

Excuses, excuses! Jess insisted that he isn't sexist, blaming his abhorrent behaviour on 'a mixture of alcohol, a stomach bug and lack of sleep'

Fragile: In the aftermath of the scandal, Jess is receiving psychiatric treatment courtesy of his local council to 'clean these hiccups from his mind'

Angie: 'Why Jess shouldn't be fired' Speaking on The Kyle and Jackie O Show on Friday, Angie said that Jess shouldn't lose his job over the scandal. After listening to audio of Jess' grovelling on-air apology, she said: 'I'm not asking him to lose his job, I just stuck up for myself and other women he was making uncomfortable. 'When I heard he made other women feel uncomfortable, that's when I saw red. I don't want him to be online bullied, I can't stand that.' Angie added that she hopes Jess will 'learn' from the experience and treat women with more respect going forward. 'I'm not asking him to lose his job': Speaking on The Kyle and Jackie O Show on Friday, Angie (pictured) said that Jess should not resign from Noosa council over the scandal

'I kind of wanted to show my good side, but the worst side of me was shown. I've never seen that side of me before.'

Jess insisted that he isn't sexist, blaming his abhorrent behaviour on 'a mixture of alcohol, a stomach bug and lack of sleep.'

'I'm not a misogynist, I don't degrade women,' he said.

In the aftermath of the scandal, Jess is receiving psychiatric treatment courtesy of his local council to 'clean these hiccups from his mind'.

He's not backing down! Despite being told to resign from his council position by Mayor Wellington (pictured on Friday), Jess has no plans to give up on his political career

'None of us thought Donald Trump would be elected either,' he said, hinting that he will defend his position at re-election

Jess added Channel 10 had provided 'lots of support' but had ultimately 'thrown him under the bus' with the show's editing.

'They emphasised certain things and told me to make certain movements during the photo shoot,' he said.

Jess also claimed he never applied for the show and was 'scouted' by producers as a potential villain.

'They rang me, they knew it was a good person to throw under the bus,' he said.

Despite being told to resign from his council position by Mayor Wellington, Jess has no plans to give up on his political career.

'None of us thought Donald Trump would be elected either,' he said, hinting that he will defend his position at re-election.

Backlash: Jess (pictured on The Bachelorette) is under investigation for a potential breach of conduct as a result of his behaviour on the show. The matter has been referred to the Office of the Independent Assessor

Jess was comforted by his father (left) on Friday as he fielded phone calls from the media

One thing he will be doing in the coming weeks is speaking out on women's issues.

He is keen to support local women's shelters for those experiencing domestic violence, perhaps in a bid to improve his own public image.

However, if his political career does fall through, Jess explained he will simply 'fall back' into his former trade as an engineer.

Meanwhile, Angie Kent has since come out in defence of Jess, telling The Kyle and Jackie O Show: 'I don't want him to lose his job.'
description: Disgraced politician Jess Glasgow is fearing for his life after receiving 'death threats' following his controversial appearance on The Bachelorette.
authors: Jo Scrimshire For Daily Mail Australia
